title.narrative: Implementation by States of their international human rights obligations and their SDG commitments

1. Further field research (and data) to understand and measure domestic implementation and impact. 2. Securing the establishment of stronger NMIRFs in more countries 3. New forums or platforms at the UN to receive information on and consider national implementation levels and challenges 4. Proposals for a new Council prevention policy framework — to guide States in operationalizing the body's prevention mandate. 5. Events, research, policy reports and counsel to support Danish priority issues for its Council membership term (2019-2021). 6. Concrete steps to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the international human rights system in the short- and medium-term. 7. Initiation of a Geneva process to feed into the GA's 2021 review of the Council. 8. Organisation of four Friday Exchange policy roundtables per year (3 in Geneva, 1 in New York). 9. Maintenance of URG's human rights toolkit, to help improve transparency and public accountability at the Human Rights Council.

Output 2: Research, ideas and proposals for the operationalization of the Council's prevention mandate — uptake of those ideas by States, and the elaboration of an effective HRC prevention policy framework

Secure Human Rights Council process or mechanism to elaborate a workable prevention strategy, in consultation with all relevant stakeholders. Coordinate with and provide input to such a process or mechanism. Secure the adoption of new policy framework. Produce analyses, including economic analyses, 'making the case for prevention.' Linked the Council's prevention mandate with the Secretary-General's wider prevention agenda, through events/activities in New York.

title.narrative: Output 3: New Human Rights Council platform or space for States, especially developing States, development partners, NHRls and others, to engage in cooperation and dialogue on human rights implementation

Establishment of cross-regional group of States focused on item 10 reform. Engagement and involvement, in developing the new platform of LDCs and SIDS, and other developing countries. Engagement, and involvement, in developing the new platform of UN and bilateral development partners. Identification and dissemination of UN human rights success stories, showing positive on-the-ground impact.
Output 1: More States, in all regions, begin to build or further development NMIRFs

Publication of URG Policy Report mapping global spread and evolution of NMIRFs, and identifying common practices and principles. Convening, via the Group of Friends, of a 'group of hosts' to coordinate a process of regional meetings of States on NMIRFs, to allow for exchanges of good practices and the elaboration of regional 'principles.' Continuation and expansion of implementation/NMlRF Group of Friends, and inclusion of relevant UN agencies. Organisation of annual meeting of bilateral and multilateral development partners, on how to support domestic human rights and SDG implementation. Publication of policy briefs on the role of parliaments and NHRls in domestic implementation and reporting. Development and launch of IMPACT OSS implementation/reporting software. Steps to create 'NHRI specific' versions of the software. Uptake by 'early adopter' States and NHRls.
